item.title: Npc rotation
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

[quote=“Canownueazy, post:8, topic:375564”][quote author=jaruanna link=topic=471504.msg3448616#msg3448616 date=1293588075]

[quote author=Canownueazy link=topic=471504.msg3448613#msg3448613 date=1293588016]

so i put in the code for npc rotation and when i do + 1, + 2, + 3, it doesnt turn the npc! HELP!

if ((newNPC.npcType == 1438) && (newNPC.absX == 3115) && (newNPC.absY == 9990)) { newNPC.TurnNpcTo(newNPC.absX + 2, newNPC.absY); } }
[/quote]newNPC.TurnNpcTo(x coordinate, y coordinate);

didnt work
[/quote]You got an error? Or what?

no, no error but when i looked at it in the game it didnt move at all. i did compile, and re-run the server

Add this underneath it

System.out.println("TURNED NPC!");

Tell me if it prints out[/quote]

no

item.title: Npc rotation
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

DivineSouls:

Where did you get this method from? Also, post the TurnNpcTo Method on here.

i got this method from this:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:8, topic:347981”]NPCHandler, newNPC method

[quote] if (newNPC.npcType == NPCID) {
if ((newNPC.absX == CoordX) && (newNPC.absY == CoordY)) {
newNPC.TurnNpcTo(newNPC.absX + 2, newNPC.absY);
}
}[/quote]
NPCID - Id of the NPC
CoordX - NPC X
CoordY - NPC Y

  • 2 - New direction, -1, +2, +3, +4

Never assume something is impossible ;)[/quote]

i made it into 2 lines instead.

and…

public void TurnNpcTo(int i, int j) { FocusPointX = 2 * i + 1; FocusPointY = 2 * j + 1; updateRequired = true; FaceDirection = true; }

this is from NPC.java and my code is in NPC Handler.java

Read full topic
